sentences: Nikola the Serb (Serbian: Никола Србин; fl.

late 14th century) was a Serbian Orthodox hieromonk, protopsaltes (chief singer) and one of the known composers of the Serbian Middle Ages, alongside Kir Stefan the Serb, Isaiah the Serb and Kir Joakim.
Cherubic Hymn, held at Athens Museum.
It is based on a Greek text, exists in both Church Slavonic and Greek versions
